itemSummaries.title: Vintage Waltham United States Watch Co. Art Deco Fancy Enamel Lever Set Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a charming vintage Waltham men’s wristwatch, featuring a beautifully ornate Art Deco enamel dial housed...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a charming vintage Waltham men’s wristwatch, featuring a beautifully ornate Art Deco enamel dial housed in a cushion-shaped Anchor case. This timepiece showcases the elegant styling of early American wristwatch conversions, highlighted by a crisp white enamel dial with black Roman numerals and a classic railway-style minute track. The blued steel hands and subsidiary seconds dial at 6 o’clock further enhance its refined period appeal.

Powering this watch is a 7-jewel manual wind lever-set movement signed United States Watch Co., Waltham, Mass. U.S.A., with a movement serial number 751855, dating it to the early 20th century. The movement was recently serviced and is running smoothly and holding accurate time. As a lever-set model, the crown does not pull out—instead, a small lever must be accessed to set the time. A discreet slot has been cut into the front edge of the case to allow the lever to be engaged without removing the bezel, though the case can still be opened traditionally if needed.

The case, made by Anchor Watch Case Co., is crafted from base metal with a stainless steel back and features fixed wire-style lugs. It is finely engraved with intricate Art Deco detailing along the bezel and sides. The case is sized at approximately 32mm excluding the crown and is fitted with a brand new high-end black leather strap, making it ready for daily wear or display.

Key Features:
• Brand: Waltham / United States Watch Co.
• Style: Art Deco pocket watch conversion
• Dial: White enamel with Roman numerals and blued hands
• Case Shape: Cushion
• Case Size: 32mm (excluding crown)
• Case Material: Base metal with stainless steel back
• Case Maker: Anchor Watch Case Co.
• Movement: 7-jewel manual wind (lever-set)
• Movement Serial #: 751855
• Strap: Brand new high-end black leather strap
• Condition: Recently serviced; running and holding accurate time; excellent vintage condition — see photos for full details

This rare early American wristwatch is a beautiful example of horological adaptation—pairing a well-preserved Waltham movement with classic Art Deco design. Ideal for collectors of U.S. timepieces, lever-set watches, or anyone looking to own a distinctive piece of American watchmaking history.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Oyster WW2 Military Men’s Manual Watch - Serviced & Running
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Rolex-built Oyster from the World War II era. Produced circa 1944–1945, this timepiece boasts an all-original design with military styl...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Rolex-built Oyster from the World War II era. Produced circa 1944–1945, this timepiece boasts an all-original design with military styling and Rolex’s legendary engineering, making it a perfect addition for collectors and vintage watch enthusiasts.



Key Features:

• Brand: Oyster Watch Co. (Rolex)

• Production Year: Circa 1944–1945 (based on serial number 364255)

• Movement: Original Rolex Caliber 59, 17 Jewels (manual wind)

• Case Size: 30mm (excluding crown)

• Dial: Original cream-tone dial with bold Arabic numerals and heat-blued steel hands

• Bracelet: Brand new high-end black leather strap

• Caseback Reference (Exterior): 364255 (serial number)

• Caseback Reference (Interior): 4453 (Rolex case reference)

• Inner Caseback Markings: Stamped “Oyster Watch Co. Geneva–Swiss,” “Patented in All Countries,” and “R.W.C. LTD”



Condition Notes:


This WW2-era watch is in excellent vintage condition. The dial features a beautiful naturally aged patina consistent with its age. The hands are original and retain their period-correct styling. The movement is clean and fully functional, holding accurate time. The stainless steel case shows minor honest wear but retains sharp edges. A brand new high-end leather strap has been fitted, but all other parts are original.



Historical Significance:


While the dial is signed “Oyster” and not “Rolex,” this watch was built by Rolex during World War II under its Oyster Watch Co. sub-brand. At the time, Rolex used this name to work around wartime tariffs and import restrictions, especially in markets like the UK and Canada. These watches featured Rolex’s patented waterproof Oyster case, robust in-house movements, and overall Rolex craftsmanship—just without the Rolex branding on the dial due to legal and logistical limitations.


The serial number (364255) dates this watch to around 1944–1945, directly aligning it with the WWII period. The interior caseback is marked with reference 4453, a known Rolex case reference used for smaller Oyster models housing the Caliber 59 movement. Also inside the caseback are factory markings that read “Oyster Watch Co. Geneva–Swiss,” and “R.W.C. LTD” (Rolex Watch Company Ltd)—definitive proof of its Rolex origin.



Whether you’re a vintage Rolex collector or a fan of military-issued timepieces, this Oyster is a rare and important watch with a direct link to Rolex’s wartime production strategy. It combines historical intrigue, original craftsmanship, and robust Swiss construction—all in a compact, military-style package.



Please Note:

This watch is sold as-is in vintage condition. While it is currently running and keeping accurate time, no guarantees are made regarding long-term accuracy or water resistance due to its age.


Feel free to reach out with any questions or for additional photos. Don’t miss this opportunity to own a fascinating and historical Rolex-built military timepiece.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Rolco Men’s Art Deco 17J Manual Watch - Running
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a charming vintage Rolco men’s wristwatch, a lesser-known but historically significant sub-brand of Rolex,&n...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a charming vintage Rolco men’s wristwatch, a lesser-known but historically significant sub-brand of Rolex, featuring a classic Art Deco design and Swiss craftsmanship. The watch is running smoothly and holding accurate time.

This piece is powered by a 17-jewel manual wind movement, marked Rolco Watch Co. Ltd. and Unadjusted Swiss, with its original “Rolco” signed mainspring barrel. The dial displays bold Arabic numerals with a subsidiary seconds register at 6 o’clock, exuding period-correct vintage character. The watch measures 32mm in diameter (excluding the crown), making it a tasteful and wearable size for vintage collectors.

While the inner case back is stamped “ROLEX,” the outer case back is a later replacement, not original to the watch. It reads: “Watchcraftsmen Cased, Stainless Steel Back, Water and Timed Resistant, Anti-Magnetic, Shock Resistant.”

It is fitted on a brand new, high-end brown leather strap that complements the vintage aesthetic beautifully.

⸻

About Rolco and Its Rolex Connection:

Rolco was one of several sub-brands created by Rolex during the early 20th century as part of a strategy to offer high-quality timepieces under different brand names for various markets. The name “Rolco” itself is derived from “Rolex Company,” and these watches were typically assembled using Rolex movements or components but sold at a lower price point than their flagship models. These timepieces were often marketed in regions such as the UK and Commonwealth countries.

Because of this relationship, Rolco watches—especially those with movements or case parts stamped “ROLEX”—are now considered collectible for their historical connection to Rolex’s early expansion and branding strategies. They represent an accessible way to own a vintage Rolex-associated piece with true horological significance.

⸻

Condition Notes:
• The watch is fully functional and runs well
• Dial shows attractive aging and patina consistent with its age
• Case is in very good condition overall with honest wear
• New premium leather strap installed
• Photos best describe the physical condition—please review closely

This vintage Rolco is a great opportunity to own a piece of Rolex’s lesser-known history. Ideal for collectors or anyone who appreciates vintage Swiss timepieces with character and provenance.

Please feel free to reach out with any questions or to request additional photos.

itemSummaries.shortDescription: Up for sale is a vintage Casio Cyber Max JG-300 men’s digital wristwatch, featuring the highly collectible module&n...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
Up for sale is a vintage Casio Cyber Max JG-300 men’s digital wristwatch, featuring the highly collectible module 1456 with built-in game functionality. This Japan-made watch is part of Casio’s iconic 1990s “Cyber Max” lineup, known for its futuristic design, built-in shock sensor, and playful gaming features.

This particular example is new old stock (NOS)—it has never been worn and was only stored over the years. It is in near-perfect physical condition with no noticeable scuffs or scratches on the case, crystal, or hardware. All functions of the watch—including the digital game—are fully tested and working perfectly.

The original band is included, and the entire watch is 100% original. The only minor flaw is some deterioration of the Cyber Max branding on the strap’s end, purely from long-term storage rather than use.

This is a fantastic opportunity to own a fully functional, unworn piece of Casio gaming watch history from the 1990s—a must-have for collectors of vintage digital watches or retro electronics.

Key Details:
• Model: Casio JG-300 Cyber Max

• Features: Built-in game, shock sensor, water resistance, stopwatch, alarm, backlight

• Country of Manufacture: Japan

Ships carefully.
Feel free to message me with any questions.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Elgin Art Deco Fancy Enamel Dial Men’s 15J Manual Engraved Cushion Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a beautifully preserved vintage Elgin men’s wristwatch, showcasing the bold geometric elegance of the A...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a beautifully preserved vintage Elgin men’s wristwatch, showcasing the bold geometric elegance of the Art Deco era with a stunning two-tone cream and pale blue enamel dial. This rare design features stylized Arabic numerals, a well-balanced sub-seconds register at 6 o’clock, and heat-blued hands that perfectly complement the icy tones of the dial. The cushion-shaped case is richly engraved on all sides, capturing the essence of 1920s American watchmaking.

This timepiece is powered by a 15-jewel Elgin manual wind movement, signed “Elgin Nat’l Watch Co. U.S.A.” with movement serial number 16364945, dating the movement to approximately 1912. It is running smoothly and holding accurate time.

The case, made by Wadsworth Watch Case Co., is constructed from their proprietary “Starwhite” white metal alloy—a durable, silvery material used as a premium base metal alternative during the early 20th century. The case reference number is 9835847, and it measures approximately 31mm (excluding crown).

The watch is completed with a brand new high-end black leather strap, offering both comfort and timeless sophistication.

Key Features:
• Brand: Elgin
• Style: Art Deco
• Dial: Fancy enamel in cream and pale blue with stylized numerals and blued hands
• Case Shape: Engraved cushion
• Case Size: 31mm (excluding crown)
• Case Material: Starwhite base metal alloy
• Case Maker: Wadsworth Watch Case Co.
• Case Ref #: 9835847
• Movement: 15-jewel manual wind
• Movement Serial #: 16364945 (circa 1912)
• Strap: Brand new black leather
• Condition: Running and holding accurate time; great physical condition (see photos)

This elegant Elgin is a remarkable surviving example of pre-Depression American horology, perfect for collectors or anyone seeking a wearable piece of vintage design history.

Up for sale is a beautifully preserved vintage Elgin men’s wristwatch, a stunning example of early American Art Deco craftsmanship. This timepiece features a 14K white gold filled case adorned with intricate geometric engravings along the bezel, sides, and lugs, making it a standout collector’s piece with exceptional visual appeal.


The watch is powered by a 17-jewel Elgin USA movement (serial 32703004), which has been recently serviced and is running smoothly, holding accurate time. It is housed in a 29mm x 32mm curved rectangular case, perfectly sized for the period and very comfortable on the wrist.


The dial is classic vintage Elgin—clean and well-preserved—with stylized numerals, blued steel hands, and a recessed sub-seconds dial at 6 o’clock. The case back is free of personal engravings and closes tightly.


This watch comes fitted on a brand new high-end black leather strap, adding a touch of modern refinement to its vintage charm.


Key Features:

• Case Size: 29mm (width excluding crown) x 32mm (lug to lug)

• Movement: Manual wind, 17 jewels, Elgin USA

• Case Material: 14K White Gold Filled

• Condition: Excellent overall; see photos for best assessment

• Strap: New high-end black leather strap (non-original)

• Runs and keeps accurate time


Don’t miss your chance to own a piece of American horological history with timeless Art Deco style.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Cyma WW1 Shrapnel Guard Trench Military Men’s Watch - Clean & Serviced
itemSummaries.shortDescription: Up for sale is a rare and historically important Vintage CYMA WWI-era Trench Watch, featuring a factory-integrated ...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
Up for sale is a rare and historically important Vintage CYMA WWI-era Trench Watch, featuring a factory-integrated metal shrapnel guard built directly into the case—a design almost never seen today. Unlike most wartime guards which were removable wire or clip-on covers, this integrated version suggests a special military commission or limited field-issue model, making it a true collector’s piece.

The watch has been recently cleaned and professionally serviced and is running strong, keeping accurate time. It comes fitted with a brand new black leather strap, ready to wear or display.

Key Features:
• Manufacturer: CYMA (Swiss Made)
• Movement: Manual wind, CYMA cal. 570 with 15 jewels
• Case Size: 44mm (excluding crown)
• Case Material: Nickel or silver-tone alloy (see photos)
• Dial: High-contrast military-style dial with inner 24-hour scale and sub-seconds at 6 o’clock
• Crystal: Domed acrylic
• Strap: Brand new black leather strap
• Shrapnel Guard: Original integrated metal guard with cutouts for viewing numerals – fits securely in place but may pop up if bumped; still fine for daily wear

Condition Notes:
• Very good vintage condition with only light wear consistent with age
• Fully functional and accurate, just serviced
• The rare strap guard remains intact and functional—an unusual survivor of WWI military watches
• Photos best describe the watch’s physical condition—please inspect closely

This is a seldom-seen example of military horology, combining robust wartime engineering with an incredibly rare case design. A must-have for any serious collector of WWI artifacts or vintage timepieces.

For sale is an incredibly rare vintage Casio M-301 Melody 30 digital watch, featuring Module 472, produced in the early 1980s—estimated around 1982–1983. This was one of Casio’s most feature-rich musical watches of the time, capable of playing 30 built-in melodies across multiple genres including Classic, Latin, Folk, and Pop.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Waltham A-17 MIL-W-6433 Hack US Military Issued Men’s Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a stunning and authentic vintage Waltham A-17 Military Navigation Watch, issued by the U.S. Military under MIL-W-6433 specifications. This is a true collector’s piece and a near-perfect ex...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a stunning and authentic vintage Waltham A-17 Military Navigation Watch, issued by the U.S. Military under MIL-W-6433 specifications. This is a true collector’s piece and a near-perfect example of a historically significant timepiece from the early Cold War era.


Details & Condition:

• Manufacturer: Waltham Watch Co.

• Model: A-17, Type A-17 Navigation Watch

• Case Size: 32mm (excluding crown)

• Case Material: Stainless steel

• Movement: Manual wind, 17 jewels, Waltham U.S.A. marked, running strong

• Hack Feature: Fully functional and precise (seconds hand stops when crown is pulled)

• Dial: Original black dial with beautifully aged patina on the luminous numerals and hands

• Crystal: Clear acrylic, excellent condition

• Case Back: Marked with full U.S. military specifications and contract/order numbers

• Bracelet: NOS vintage stainless steel Bonklip bracelet – correct for the era and looks fantastic

• Condition: Excellent – Running accurately, fully serviced, and ready to wear or display


Historical Significance:


The Waltham A-17 is a military navigation watch issued in the 1950s to U.S. Air Force and other service members. Built to MIL-W-6433 standards, this watch was designed for precision and reliability in extreme conditions. It replaced earlier WWII models and introduced refinements like improved luminous markers and a hacking seconds feature – essential for synchronized military operations.


Unlike civilian watches, these were government-issued and property of the U.S. military, as noted on the case back. The fact that this example still has a fully functional hacking feature and a clean, crisp dial makes it an exceptional survivor.


This watch is not only a functional timekeeper but a piece of military history. These were used during critical Cold War missions, training exercises, and flights—each one tells a story.


Why This Watch is Special:

• Authentic U.S. Military-issued watch with full markings

• All-original dial with gorgeous patina

• Functioning hack feature – rare to find fully operational

• Clean, unrestored movement in excellent shape

• Comes with a period-correct Bonklip bracelet – a NOS example

• A rare and investment-worthy timepiece


Don’t miss your chance to own a well-preserved piece of horological and military history.



Please Note: This watch is sold as-is, in vintage condition, with no guarantees regarding future accuracy due to its age.

First introduced during the height of the Art Deco era, this timepiece was renowned for its distinctive design, fine craftsmanship, and vibrant enamel detailing. itemSummaries.title: Vintage Elgin Art Deco Fancy Enamel Dial 7J Men’s Manual Watch - Serviced
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a beautifully preserved vintage Elgin men’s wristwatch, showcasing a stunning Art Deco design with a&nb...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a beautifully preserved vintage Elgin men’s wristwatch, showcasing a stunning Art Deco design with a unique two-tone case and exquisite enamel Roman numeral dial. This timepiece is powered by a 7-jewel manual wind Elgin movement (serial 14083011) that has been recently serviced and is running smoothly, holding accurate time.

The dial features elegant Roman numerals in a deep black tone set against a creamy white enamel base, framed by intricate gold detailing. Ornate Louis XV-style hands complete the watch’s refined, period-authentic character. The subsidiary seconds dial at 6 o’clock adds both utility and visual balance.

The case is a handsome cushion-style design with a 10k rolled gold front and a stainless steel back, manufactured by Elite Watch Case Co. This type of case requires the removal of the crown and stem in order to open it and access the movement — a correct and intentional design choice from this era. Please note: the movement is shown outside of the case in the photos strictly to document this internal detail. The watch is not broken or damaged in any way — it functions perfectly as designed.

The watch measures approximately 30mm across (excluding crown) and is fitted with a brand new high-end black leather strap, making it ready for immediate wear or elegant display.

Key Features:
• Brand: Elgin
• Style: Art Deco
• Dial: Enamel with Roman numerals and gold embellishments
• Hands: Louis XV-style ornate hands
• Case Shape: Cushion
• Case Size: 30mm (excluding crown)
• Case Material: 10k rolled gold front, stainless steel back
• Case Maker: Elite Watch Case Co.
• Movement: 7-jewel manual wind
• Movement Serial #: 14083011 (circa 1909)
• Strap: Brand new high-end black leather strap
• Condition: Fully functional, recently serviced, running and holding accurate time
• Note on Case Access: Case must be opened by first removing crown and stem — this is the correct design for this model

This elegant vintage Elgin is a wonderful example of early American wristwatch design with a rare Roman numeral Art Deco dial and well-preserved movement. A distinctive collector’s piece, ideal for enthusiasts of 1920s-30s horology or wearable vintage charm.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Rolco Silver Cushion Unisex Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Rolco by Rolex wristwatch housed in a solid 0.800 silver cushion case. This timepiece is running smoothly, holding accurate time, and f...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Rolco by Rolex wristwatch housed in a solid 0.800 silver cushion case. This timepiece is running smoothly, holding accurate time, and features a 28mm case size. It comes mounted on a brand new high-end black leather strap, ready for immediate wear or display.


Rolco—short for Rolex Company—was an early sub-brand created by Rolex in the 1920s and 1930s. Designed to offer the precision and reliability of Rolex at a more accessible price point, Rolco watches often shared components, movements, and finishing details with their Rolex-branded counterparts. These timepieces serve as a fascinating chapter in Rolex’s early expansion and innovation.


This example features a sharp, black sector dial with luminous Arabic numerals, a sub-seconds register at 6 o’clock, and cathedral-style hands—capturing the unmistakable elegance of 1930s design. The cushion-shaped case is constructed from solid 0.800 silver (80% silver purity), and is fully hallmarked inside with Swiss silver assay marks, including the “BREVET” patent stamp.


Key Features:

• Brand: Rolco (Rolex Company)

• Movement: Original Rolco movement

• Case Material: Solid 0.800 silver

• Case Size: 28mm (excluding crown)

• Dial: Original black sector dial with luminous numerals and sub-seconds

• Condition: Running and holding accurate time

• Strap: Brand new high-end black leather strap


This rare and authentic Rolco timepiece represents a unique opportunity for collectors and vintage enthusiasts alike to own a historically significant Rolex-associated watch.


Feel free to reach out with any questions or for additional photos.


Please Note: This vintage watch is sold as-is. While it is currently running and keeping time, no guarantee is made regarding future accuracy or water resistance due to its age.

itemSummaries.shortDescription: This stunning antique Rolco by Rolex 9ct solid gold cocktail watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 26mm case and o...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
This stunning antique Rolco by Rolex 9ct solid gold cocktail watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 26mm case and original two tone dial this piece exudes unmatched classic elegance.


Rolco was a brand created by Hans Wilsdorf, the founder of Rolex, in the early 20th century as part of his strategy to expand the company’s reach and market. While Rolex focused on premium timepieces, Rolco was used for more affordable, less prestigious watches, often catering to different demographics. Some Rolco watches shared components with Rolex, including movements and cases, though they were typically of a simpler design. The brand eventually faded as Rolex solidified its reputation for luxury and phased out secondary labels.


Key Features:


• Brand: Rolco (Rolex)

• Case Size: 26mm (excluding crown)

• Material: 9ct Solid Gold

• Condition: Pre-owned, antique

• Movement: Mechanical, hand-wound

• Functionality: Fully running and holding accurate time

• Dial: Original two tone dial with bold Arabic numerals

• Bracelet: Original rolled gold bracelet

• Era: Circa 1920s/1930s

• Caseback: Marked with Rolex insignia, 9ct hallmark, and reference number 75136

For sale is a vintage Seiko Ski Thermo S821-6000 digital watch, a rare and highly collectible model designed for outdoor and winter sports enthusiasts. Produced circa 1990 to 1992, this Ski Thermo is part of Seiko’s early ’90s lineup of rugged adventure watches. This example is in new without tags condition and is fully functional—every feature works exactly as it should.

The watch is in near flawless physical condition, with no noticeable scratches, scuffs, or significant signs of wear. Please refer to the detailed photos provided for the best representation of its cosmetic condition.

One of the standout features of the Seiko Ski Thermo is its rotating bezel, which allows you to easily switch between different modes, including Time, Alarm, Thermometer, Chronograph Graph, and Time Difference. The bezel rotates smoothly and clicks firmly into place at each setting, making the watch intuitive and highly practical for active use, even with gloves.

This Ski Thermo comes on its original Seiko ski-themed fabric strap, which is also in outstanding condition, showing virtually no fraying or wear—a rarity for these models. The bright yellow accents on the strap and buttons retain their vibrant color, enhancing the overall sporty and retro aesthetic.

• Rotating Bezel for Easy Mode Selection

• Original Seiko Ski Fabric Strap – Near Mint Condition

This Seiko Ski Thermo is extremely hard to find, especially in this exceptional condition with the original strap intact. It’s a must-have for serious Seiko collectors, vintage sports watch enthusiasts, or anyone looking for a standout piece with retro tech features.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Texswiss Dual Compass Quartz Military Full Set Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a vintage Texswiss Compass Watch in exceptional, nearly new condition. This Swiss-made timepiece features a rugged, tactical design complete with an integrated analog compass, a rotating b...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a vintage Texswiss Compass Watch in exceptional, nearly new condition. This Swiss-made timepiece features a rugged, tactical design complete with an integrated analog compass, a rotating bezel, and a highly legible dial with luminous hands and indices. The quartz movement is reliable and currently running with a brand-new battery, keeping accurate time. The watch comes with its original presentation box, warranty paperwork, instruction manual, and an extra rubber strap, making it a complete collector’s set.


The case and strap are in outstanding condition, showing minimal if any signs of wear. The compass watch head can be swiveled out for viewing. This model is shockproof, waterproof to 100M (10 ATM), and built with all stainless steel components for durability.


Brand History:

Texswiss was a niche Swiss watchmaker known for producing durable and function-forward timepieces during the late 20th century. Marketed in the U.S. through the Atlantic Eastern Corporation, Texswiss watches gained popularity for their reliability, affordability, and rugged aesthetics—especially models like this compass-equipped sport watch that catered to adventurers, outdoor enthusiasts, and tactical users.

itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is an iconic and elegant Cartier Ceinture 78099 watch, a true collector’s item from the 1970s - early 1980s. This timepiece represents Cartier’s innovative design and craftsmanship, embodying timeless sophistication. Recently serviced, this watch is in excellent condition and is keeping accurate time.


A Brief History of the Cartier Ceinture:

The Cartier Ceinture (“belt” in French) was introduced in the 1970s, featuring a unique octagonal case that resembles a belt buckle. This model showcases Cartier’s ability to combine artistic creativity with functional design, making it one of the most sought-after vintage pieces among Cartier enthusiasts. Its distinctive style and refined elegance stand out in the world of vintage luxury watches.


Key Features:

• Model: Cartier Ceinture 78099

• Case Size: 27mm

• Movement: Manual wind

• Case Material: Solid 18k gold

• Strap: Brand new high end black leather strap

• Buckle: Genuine gold plated Cartier buckle

• Condition: Recently serviced and running perfectly, keeping accurate time



Whether you are a vintage Cartier collector or simply looking for a refined, unique timepiece, this Cartier Ceinture is a rare find that will elevate any watch collection. Its timeless elegance and historical significance make it a true treasure.


Feel free to reach out with any questions or to request additional photos.


Please Note: This watch is sold as-is, in vintage condition, with no guarantees on future performance due to its age.

itemSummaries.shortDescription: This vintage Rolex Dunklings telephone dial wristwatch is a classic example of early 20th-century craftsmanship. Made from 9ct solid gold, it features a distinctive 26mm case and an elegant telephone-...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
This vintage Rolex Dunklings telephone dial wristwatch is a classic example of early 20th-century craftsmanship. Made from 9ct solid gold, it features a distinctive 26mm case and an elegant telephone-style numeral dial. The watch is running well and holding accurate time, making it a functional piece of history. Additionally, the case back is ornately engraved with a detailed floral pattern, adding a unique aesthetic touch to its already charming character.


The watch includes its original fitted box and original 9ct solid gold mesh bracelet, marked “9CT GOLD.” The bracelet has been carefully preserved but has been replaced for daily wear with a brand new high-end Hirsch Robert leather strap in burgundy with gold hardware, offering both sophistication and comfort.



About Dunklings:


Dunklings was a well-established jeweler in Australia, known for selling high-quality timepieces from brands such as Rolex. In the early 20th century, Rolex partnered with select retailers, including Dunklings, to offer exclusive models tailored to regional markets. These watches often featured unique designs that set them apart from standard Rolex models, making them an intriguing part of Rolex’s history and appealing to collectors.



Key Features:

• Brand: Rolex (Dunklings Collaboration, Australia)

• Case Size: 26mm (excluding crown)

• Material: 9ct Solid Gold

• Condition: Pre-owned, antique

• Movement: Mechanical, hand-wound

• Functionality: Fully running and holding accurate time

• Dial: Telephone-style Arabic numeral dial with blued steel hands

• Case Shape: Unique angular design with hinged case back

• Strap: Brand new Hirsch Robert leather strap in burgundy and gold

• Extras: Original 9ct gold mesh bracelet (marked “9CT GOLD”) included

• Case Back: Beautifully engraved with floral motif

• Inner Caseback: Stamped with Rolex insignia, “7 World’s Records,” “Gold Medal,” “Geneva – Suisse,” and case number 384



Please feel free to ask any questions or request additional photos.

itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a Cartier Pre-Must Stepped Tank Watch, a highly collectible piece showcasing Cartier’s iconic design from the mid-20th century. This elegant timepiece, with its stepped case and rich blue dial, represents the timeless sophistication and craftsmanship for which Cartier is celebrated. This watch is running and keeping accurate time, making it both functional and stylish for daily wear or as a collector’s item.


A Brief History of the Cartier Stepped Tank:


The Cartier Tank, first introduced in 1917, has evolved into one of the most recognizable watch designs in history. The Stepped Tank, a less commonly seen variation, incorporates layered detailing on the case for an added touch of refinement. This Pre-Must model predates the “Must de Cartier” line, offering a more exclusive appeal with vintage charm. Its design bridges the gap between early 20th-century elegance and modern aesthetics.


Key Features:

• Model: Cartier Pre-Must Stepped Tank

• Case Size: 27mm

• Case Material: 18k Gold Electroplated

• Dial: Original deep blue with Roman numeral hour markers

• Movement: Manual wind, running accurately

• Crown: Original Cartier with blue cabochon detail

• Strap: Aftermarket blue leather strap (non-Cartier, complements the dial perfectly)

• Condition: All original watch components; recently tested and holding accurate time

This watch is being sold as-is and in vintage condition. No guarantees on future performance due to its vintage nature.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Rolco 9ct Gold Enamel Dial Men’s Art Deco Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: This stunning antique Rolco by Rolex 9ct solid gold men’s watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 32mm unique shaped...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
This stunning antique Rolco by Rolex 9ct solid gold men’s watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 32mm unique shaped case and original white enamel dial, this piece exudes unmatched classic elegance.


Rolco was a brand created by Hans Wilsdorf, the founder of Rolex, in the early 20th century as part of his strategy to expand the company’s reach and market. While Rolex focused on premium timepieces, Rolco was used for more affordable, less prestigious watches, often catering to different demographics. Some Rolco watches shared components with Rolex, including movements and cases, though they were typically of a simpler design. The brand eventually faded as Rolex solidified its reputation for luxury and phased out secondary labels.


Key Features:


• Brand: Rolco (Rolex)

• Case Size: 32mm (excluding crown)

• Material: 9ct Solid Gold

• Condition: Pre-owned, antique

• Movement: Mechanical, hand-wound

• Functionality: Fully running and holding accurate time

• Dial: Original enamel dial with bold Arabic numerals

• Bracelet: Brand new burgundy leather strap

• Era: Circa 1920s/1930s

• Caseback: Marked with Rolex insignia, 9ct hallmark, and reference number 110669



Please feel free to ask any questions or request additional photos.


Note: This watch is sold as-is, in vintage condition, with no guarantees regarding future accuracy due to its age.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Rolco 9ct Gold Men’s Cushion Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: This stunning antique Rolco by Rolex 9ct solid gold cushion watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 30mm cushion sha...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
This stunning antique Rolco by Rolex 9ct solid gold cushion watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 30mm cushion shaped case and original white patina dial, this piece exudes unmatched classic elegance.


Rolco was a brand created by Hans Wilsdorf, the founder of Rolex, in the early 20th century as part of his strategy to expand the company’s reach and market. While Rolex focused on premium timepieces, Rolco was used for more affordable, less prestigious watches, often catering to different demographics. Some Rolco watches shared components with Rolex, including movements and cases, though they were typically of a simpler design. The brand eventually faded as Rolex solidified its reputation for luxury and phased out secondary labels.


Key Features:


• Brand: Rolco (Rolex)

• Case Size: 30mm (excluding crown)

• Material: 9ct Solid Gold

• Condition: Pre-owned, antique

• Case Shape: Cushion

• Bracelet: Brand new high end Hirsch black and gold leather strap

• Caseback: Marked with Rolex insignia & 9ct hallmark

itemSummaries.fullDescription:
This vintage Rolex Dunklings telephone dial wristwatch is a classic example of early 20th-century craftsmanship. Made from 9ct solid gold, it features a distinctive 26mm case and an elegant telephone-style numeral dial. The watch is running well and holding accurate time, making it a functional piece of history. Additionally, the case back is engraved with an elegant monogram and the date 19-6-24, adding a personal touch to its rich past.



About Dunklings:


Dunklings was a well-established jeweler in Australia, known for selling high-quality timepieces from brands such as Rolex. In the early 20th century, Rolex partnered with select retailers, including Dunklings, to offer exclusive models tailored to regional markets. These watches often featured unique designs that set them apart from standard Rolex models, making them an intriguing part of Rolex’s history and appealing to collectors.



Key Features:

• Brand: Rolex (Dunklings Collaboration, Australia)

• Case Size: 26mm (excluding crown)

• Material: 9ct Solid Gold

• Condition: Pre-owned, antique

• Movement: Mechanical, hand-wound

• Functionality: Fully running and holding accurate time

• Dial: Telephone-style Arabic numeral dial with blued steel hands

• Case Shape: Unique angular design with hinged case back

• Bracelet: Black leather strap

• Engraving: Monogrammed case back with the date 19-6-24

• Caseback: Marked with Rolex insignia, “Dunklings,” and 9ct gold hallmark



Please feel free to ask any questions or request additional photos.


Note: This watch is sold as-is, in vintage condition, with no guarantees regarding future accuracy due to its age.

itemSummaries.fullDescription:
Up for sale is an iconic and elegant Cartier Vendome 78090 Watch


A true collector’s item from the early era of Cartier’s Vendome series. This timepiece embodies timeless sophistication, combining classic design with impeccable craftsmanship. The watch has been recently serviced and is running accurately.


A Brief History of the Cartier Vendome:


Introduced as part of Cartier’s golden era, the Vendome line set a new standard for minimalist elegance. Named after the Place Vendôme in Paris, a hub of luxury and refinement, this model boasts an unmistakable round case with clean lines. The early Vendome watches, such as this one, are particularly desirable for their Paris Mark 1 dials, unique features, and intricate craftsmanship. A rare first-series model, it features bronzed hands rather than the commonly seen blued hands, adding to its historical significance.


Key Features:

• Model: Cartier Vendome 78090

• Case Size: 33mm

• Movement: Manual wind (recently serviced, running, and holding accurate time)

• Case Material: Solid 18k gold

• Dial: Paris Mark 1 dial with desirable spidering patina

• Hands: Bronzed (first-series characteristic)

• Crystal: Sapphire

• Strap: Brand new burgundy ostrich leather band

• Buckle: 18k Cartier deployant clasp



Condition:


This vintage Cartier Vendome is in excellent working condition for its age, with a beautiful patina on the Paris Mark 1 dial. The spidering effect on the dial adds character, making it a prized piece for vintage collectors. The newly added burgundy ostrich leather strap complements the gold case perfectly, and the Cartier deployant clasp completes the look with sophistication.

Rolwatco, short for Rolex Watch Company, was a hallmark of early 20th-century Swiss watch craftsmanship, known for producing high-quality timepieces with distinctive designs. Established as a precursor to the globally renowned Rolex brand, Rolwatco pieces often featured unique case shapes, intricate enamel dials, and precision movements. Today, Rolwatco watches are cherished by collectors for their historical significance and rarity, offering a glimpse into the formative years of one of the world’s most prestigious watchmakers.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Sterling Silver Art Deco Enamel Cocktail Watch With Original Box
itemSummaries.shortDescription: This beautiful antique Rolex cocktail watch is a timeless classic, ideal for watch collectors and vintage enthusiasts alike. With a distinctive design and refined craftsmanship, this piece exudes vint...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
This beautiful antique Rolex cocktail watch is a timeless classic, ideal for watch collectors and vintage enthusiasts alike. With a distinctive design and refined craftsmanship, this piece exudes vintage charm and sophistication.


This particular example stands out for its unusually large 30mm case size, as most cocktail watches of the era were considerably smaller—typically around 24-26mm. The bold size combined with the exquisite enamel Roman numeral dial, featuring a striking red “XII,” adds to its visual presence and rarity.


Adding even more value and historical appeal is its original presentation box from F. Hallett, a renowned Goldsmith and Silversmith based at 28 Railway Street, Altrincham, England. F. Hallett was a respected regional jeweler during the early 20th century, known for offering high-end timepieces and jewelry, making this original packaging a meaningful piece of provenance.



Key Features:


• Brand: Rolex

• Case Size: 30mm (excluding crown) – rare large format

• Case Material: Sterling Silver (.925), hallmarked inside case back

• Movement: Mechanical, hand-wound – marked Rolex Swiss on movement

• Condition: Pre-owned, antique

• Functionality: Running and holding accurate time

• Dial: Original white enamel dial with Roman numerals and ornate hands

• Crown: Original fluted crown with gilt finish

• Band: Original expandable sterling silver bracelet, marked “Sterling” and “Prov. Pat”

• Presentation Box: Original fitted F. Hallett box, lined in silk and velvet

• Era: Estimated 1920s



This Rolex represents a rare opportunity to acquire an authentic Art Deco-era piece that merges horological significance with elegant design. Its originality, uncommon size, and preserved box from a known period jeweler make it especially collectible.


Please feel free to ask any questions or request additional photos.


Note: The watch is sold as-is, in vintage condition, and due to its age, no guarantees are made regarding long-term accuracy.

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Unicorn 9ct Gold Men’s Cushion Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: This stunning antique Rolex Unicorn 9ct solid gold cushion watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 30mm cushion shap...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
This stunning antique Rolex Unicorn 9ct solid gold cushion watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 30mm cushion shaped case and original white patina dial, this piece exudes unmatched classic elegance.


Rolex, renowned for its luxury timepieces, launched the “Unicorn” line under its subsidiary brand to offer high-quality watches at a more affordable price point. The Unicorn watches were often produced in collaboration with companies like British Watch Case Ltd. (BWC) and featured distinct designs, such as cushion-shaped cases and Swiss manual-wind movements. These watches, while branded differently, maintained Rolex’s standard for precision and durability, making them collectible among vintage enthusiasts. The Unicorn line is a fascinating piece of Rolex history, representing the brand’s effort to diversify its offerings during the mid-20th century.


Key Features:


• Brand: Rolex

• Case Size: 28mmx30mm (excluding crown)

• Material: 9ct Solid Gold

• Condition: Pre-owned, antique

• Movement: Mechanical, hand-wound

• Functionality: Fully running and holding accurate time

• Dial: Original white patina dial with blued steel hands and bold Arabic Numerals

• Case Shape: Cushion/rectangle

• Bracelet: Brand new high end Hirsch burgundy and gold leather strap

• Era: Circa 1920s/1930s

• Caseback: Marked with Rolex insignia & 9ct hallmark

itemSummaries.title: Vintage Rolex Rolco 9ct Gold Enamel Dial Cocktail Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: This stunning antique Rolco by Rolex 9ct solid gold cocktail watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 26mm unique oct...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
This stunning antique Rolco by Rolex 9ct solid gold cocktail watch is a rare and timeless treasure, perfect for collectors or vintage watch enthusiasts. Featuring a beautifully crafted 26mm unique octagon shaped case and original white enamel dial, this piece exudes unmatched classic elegance.


Rolco was a brand created by Hans Wilsdorf, the founder of Rolex, in the early 20th century as part of his strategy to expand the company’s reach and market. While Rolex focused on premium timepieces, Rolco was used for more affordable, less prestigious watches, often catering to different demographics. Some Rolco watches shared components with Rolex, including movements and cases, though they were typically of a simpler design. The brand eventually faded as Rolex solidified its reputation for luxury and phased out secondary labels.


Key Features:


• Brand: Rolco (Rolex)

• Case Size: 26mm (excluding crown)

• Material: 9ct Solid Gold

• Condition: Pre-owned, antique

• Movement: Mechanical, hand-wound

• Functionality: Fully running and holding accurate time

• Dial: Original enamel dial with bold Roman Numerals and art deco style detailing around the edges

• Case Shape: Unique rounded/octagon case

• Bracelet: Black leather strap

• Era: Circa 1920s/1930s

• Caseback: Marked with Rolex insignia, 9ct hallmark, and reference number 107217



Please feel free to ask any questions or request additional photos.


Note: This watch is sold as-is, in vintage condition, with no guarantees regarding future accuracy due to its age.

itemSummaries.title: Rare Vintage German Rolex Stossicher Oyster Junior Sport WW2 Military Mens Watch
itemSummaries.shortDescription: For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Oyster Watch Company (Rolex) Oyster Junior Sport from the World War II era, featuring a rare German-market “Stossicher” dial. This time...
itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Oyster Watch Company (Rolex) Oyster Junior Sport from the World War II era, featuring a rare German-market “Stossicher” dial. This timepiece boasts an all-original design, making it an exceptional addition for serious collectors and vintage military watch enthusiasts.


Key Features:

• Model: Oyster Junior Sport

• Movement: Original Rolex Caliber 59, 15 Rubies (shock-protected)

• Case Size: 29mm

• Crown: Appears to have been modified at some point and is no longer a screw-down, but it still functions perfectly, sits tight and flush to the case, and does not affect usability in any way

• Dial: Original dial with “STOSSICHER” (German for shock resistant) script – incredibly rare wartime variant

• Bracelet: Original stainless steel expandable stretch bracelet

• Caseback: Marked with ref. 84423 / 228CF

• Condition: The watch is running smoothly and keeping accurate time



Why This Watch Is Exceptionally Rare:


This specific example is exceptionally rare due to the “Stossicher” marking on the dial, a German word meaning shock resistant. During World War II, Rolex and its affiliated companies like the Oyster Watch Co. primarily supplied watches to Allied forces. Seeing a German-language dial variant from this era—especially with Rolex’s proprietary waterproof Oyster case—is incredibly unusual and believed to be a rare export piece to Axis-occupied territories or neutral markets like Switzerland.


The presence of “Stossicher” instead of English or French shock-resistance terms adds tremendous historical intrigue, suggesting this watch may have been targeted for sale in German-speaking regions during the wartime period. It’s a true military-era survivor, preserved with originality and character.



Condition Notes:


This watch has aged with beautiful vintage patina on the dial and hands. The original lume is intact and untouched. The movement is clean, functional, and accurate, powered by the robust Rolex Caliber 59. All parts appear correct, including the original steel Oyster case. While the crown may have been modified and no longer screws down, it sits tight and flush and does not affect performance. The original steel expansion bracelet completes the package, a rare survivor in itself.


Whether you’re a vintage Rolex collector, a military watch enthusiast, or someone who appreciates unique WWII artifacts, this Oyster Junior Sport “Stossicher” is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to own a historically significant and incredibly rare Rolex-affiliated timepiece.


Feel free to reach out with any questions or to request more photos.


Please Note: This is a vintage timepiece being sold in as-is condition. While it is currently keeping accurate time, no guarantees can be made about future timekeeping or water resistance due to its age.

itemSummaries.fullDescription:
For sale is a remarkable piece of horological history: a genuine Oyster Watch Company (Rolex) Oyster Raleigh from the World War II era. This timepiece boasts an all-original design, making it a perfect addition for collectors and vintage watch enthusiasts.


Key Features:


• Model: Oyster Raleigh

• Movement: Original Caliber 59

• Case Size: 29mm

• Condition: The watch is running smoothly and keeping accurate time

• Dial: Original dial with blued steel hands and Arabic numerals for that classic vintage military aesthetic

• Bracelet: Extremely rare, NOS era-correct Bonklip bracelet


Condition Notes:

This watch has aged gracefully with visible signs of wear, but all components, including the dial, hands, and case, are in original condition, maintaining its vintage authenticity. The movement is working perfectly, and the watch keeps time accurately, a testament to its robust Caliber 59 movement.


Whether you are a vintage Rolex collector or a lover of military timepieces, this Rolex Oyster Raleigh is a rare find, especially with all original parts intact and the unique Bonklip bracelet. Don’t miss the opportunity to own a piece of Rolex history!


Feel free to reach out with any questions or for additional photos.


Please Note: This watch is sold as-is, in vintage condition, with no guarantees regarding future accuracy due to its age.
